intro: Adesmia oxalidiphylla, commonly known as the yellow burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes and beans, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its seeds are encased in spiny, spherical pods, which aid in seed dispersal. Adesmia oxalidiphylla is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
